wikipedia_page.main: William Kelly (May 1821 – 27 March 1906) was a prominent Northern Irish member of the Plymouth Brethren, amongst whom he was a prolific writer.

response: William Kelly, Willie Kelly or Bill Kelly may refer to:
*William Kelly (footballer, born 1937), English footballer known as 'Brian'
*William Kelly (biblical scholar) (1821–1906), classicist and Biblical expositor
*William Kelly (inventor) (1811–1888), American inventor of a steel smelting process
*William Kelly (Alabama politician) (1786–1834), Alabama politician and U.S. senator
*William Kelly (New South Wales politician) (1875–1932), Australian politician
*William Kelly (New York state senator) (1807–1872), New York politician
*William Kelly (New Zealand politician) (1840–1907), New Zealand Member of Parliament

Protestant formulations and defenses of VPI by the likes of François Gaussen (Theopneustia: The Plenary Inspiration of the Holy Scriptures), Dean Burgon (Inspiration and Interpretation), Charles Henry Waller (The Authoritative Inspiration of Holy Scripture, as distinct from the Inspiration of its Human Authors), William Kelly (God's Inspiration of the Scriptures), and others, have been highly praised.
